input: to contain inflation in the forecasted period . during the fiscal year 201516 , the financial sector which comprises mainly banking and insurance services was broadly stable and growing rapidly both in terms of size and number of services . the sector has also continued to tap into new opportunities of mobilizing savings through expansion of branch networks and introduction of digital channels as well as new financial instruments . despite these challenges in the external environment , the bank has managed to register a total asset and capital level of birr 16.8 billion and birr 2.1 billion as at june 30 , 2016 , showing a growth of 23.1 percent and 17.3 percent , respectively as compared to the preceding fiscal year . its total deposit balance also reached birr 13.6 billion rising by 22.6 percent over the figure registered last year . similarly , during the stated period the total outstanding loans and advances of the bank stood at birr 8.0 billion , exhibiting a 35.6 percent growth over the previous years balance . in addition , the bank secured a total income of birr 1.6 billion , but incurred a total expense of birr 1.2 billion . thus , the gross profit before tax and after provision became birr 487.2 million surpassing that of the preceding fiscal year by birr 113.3 million or 30.3 percent . honorable shareholders ! chief executive officer dear honorable shareholders ! it is my pleasure to present the performance report of the bank of abyssinia s.c. for the fiscal year ended june 30 , 2016. it had been a year of satisfactory achievements in financial and operational results with tremendous efforts exerted towards bringing excellent customer service and growth . the fiscal year 201516 was a period in which the countrys growth momentum has continued with stable macro-economic environment . it was also a period in which the execution of gtp ii started . in this plan , financial institutions are required to have considerable involvement towards enhancing financial accessibility and deposit mobilization efforts . to this end , the government has planned to mobilize more than birr 1.8 trillion deposit through commercial banks as well as micro- finance institutions . the national bank of ethiopia nbe has also instructed all private commercial banks to scale up their annual branch expansion and annual deposit average growth by 25 percent and 30 percent , respectively . accordingly , commercial banks which are the main financial operators have kept on their aggressive branch expansion introduction of annual 2016 2015 report 10 bank of abyssinia s.c. technology-based alternative service delivery channels and other complementary banking services targeting various cross sections of the society . they have tremendously expanded their outreach , making the competition among themselves for resource mobilization more stiffer than ever . bank of abyssinia has commenced implementing its 4th five-year strategic plan and organization transformation deliverables , which are prepared in consultation with an international consultant known as deloitte consulting plc . this new strategic plan and organizational configuration is crafted to take full advantage of all opportunities and achieve better growth in the strategic period . it would also undoubtedly help the bank challenge and edge its competitors . even if it is in its early stage of implementation , the new strategic plan and organizational configuration has helped the bank to scale up its branch networks to 185 adding 53 new branches and sub-branches during the fiscal year 201516 alone . the bank has also expanded other alternative service delivery channels by installing 82 atms as well as placing 138 pos machines at merchant sites . as a result , the number of card and mobile banking users of the bank reached 58,359 and 41,797 respectively . in addition , the bank has established business relationship and signed agreement with two additional international money transfer companies namely , money queen express and chime inc. during the reviewed fiscal year . on the other hand , the task and annual deposit average growth by 25 percent and 30 percent , respectively . accordingly , commercial banks which are the main financial operators have kept on their aggressive branch expansion its 4th five-year strategic plan and organization transformation deliverables , which are prepared in consultation with an international consultant known as deloitte consulting plc . this new strategic plan and organizational configuration is crafted to take full advantage of all opportunities and achieve better growth in the strategic period . it would also undoubtedly help the bank of mastercard online testing has been finalized and the acquiring of mastercard service on our atm

input: any gains and losses arising from changes in value of the assets are recognized from this date . when the bank becomes a party to the contractual terms comprising a loan and as a consequence has the legal right to receive principal and interest payments on the loan , it controls the economic benefits associated with the loan . normally , a bank becomes a party to the contractual provisions that comprise a loan i.e . acquires legal ownership of the loan on the date of the advance of funds or payment to the third party . as a result , a commitment to lend fund is not recognized as an asset on the balance sheet . iii de-recognizing of financial instruments all financial assets are de-recognized when the bank loses control over the contractual rights that comprise the assets . this occurs when the rights are realized , expired or are surrendered . a financial liability is de-recognized when it is extinguished . iv measurement of financial instruments the bank measures all financial instruments initially at cost including transaction costs . annual 2016 2015 report 29 bank of abyssinia s.c. c. loans and advances loans and advances are financial instruments originated by the bank by providing money to the debtors . the loans and advances are stated at cost less impairment losses . impairment losses comprise specific provisions against debts identified as bad and doubtful and general provisions against losses which are likely to be present in any loans and advances portfolio . the bank follows the national bank of ethiopia , supervision of banking business directive sbb 432008 in determining the extent of provisions for impairment losses . the directive classifies loans and advances into the following i pass loans loans and advances in this category are fully protected by the current financial and paying capacity of the borrower and are not subject to criticism . in general , loans and advances , which are fully secured , both as to principal and interest , by cash or cash substitutes , are classified under this category regardless of past due status or other adverse credit factors . ii special mention any loan or advance past due 30 days or more but less than 90 days is classified under this category . iii substandard non-performing loans or advances past due 90 days or more but less than 180 days is classified under this category . iv doubtful non-performing loans or advances past due 180 days or more but less than 360 days is classified as doubtful . v losses non-performing loans or advances past due 360 days is classified as loss . as per the directive , the provision for impairment losses is determined using the following minimum provision percentages against the outstanding principal amount of each loan and advances . no . loan category extent of provision required 1 pass loans 1 of the outstanding loan balance 2 special mention loans 3 of the outstanding loan balance 3 substandard loans 20 of the net loan balance 4 doubtful loans 50

input: have control over decision of the bank . the terms of these transactions were approved by the banks management on agreed terms . annual 2016 2015 report 43 bank of abyssinia s.c. 30. risk management the bank has exposure to the following risks from its use of financial instruments . asset and liability management committee is responsible for implementing appropriate policy , procedure , risk management techniques and managing all types of risks in the bank . credit risk credit risk is the financial exposure resulting from a banks dependence on another party to discharge an obligation as agreed and cause the bank to incur a financial loss . the bank has established a credit risk management system on the basis of maximizing return on its assets while keeping its credit exposure within acceptable limits . the bank regularly reviews its credit portfolio quality , provisioning requirements and customer exposure . the banks loans and advances are diversified in various sectors as shown innote 5 to the financial statements . liquidity risk liquidity risk arises in the general funding activities of the bank and the management of positions . it includes the risk of being unable to fund assets at appropriate maturities and rates and the risk of being unable to liquidate an asset at a reasonable price and in appropriate time frame . the bank has a reasonable funding base . funds are raised mainly from customers deposits . the maturity profile is monitored by the oversight asset and liability management committee to ensure adequate liquidity is maintained . foreign exchange risk foreign exchange risk results from changes in exchange rates between a banks domestic currency and other currencies . foreign exchange risks are controlled by maintaining balances in major currencies whose exchange rates against the reporting currency have always been appreciating . the bank settles foreign exchange transactions of customers at the exchange rate prevailing on the date of the transactions . hence , the customers bear the cost of any increase in the exchange rates . interest rate risk interest rate risk is a risk resulting from changes in interest rates . it is the probability that the rising and falling of interest rates will adversely affect the banks interest margin or the value of its net worth . the bank often revises its lending rate across segments of the credit portfolio based on changes in the cost of funds , reserve requirements and the perceived risk in each credit portfolio segment to keep the overall profitability . the assets and liability management committee is responsible for managing rate-sensitive assets and liabilities and the effects of rate , volume and mix changes in order to preserve and optimize the interest return . operational risk operational risk is the risk of loss resulting from inadequate or failed internal process and systems , fraud , malpractices or external events . the bank manages its operational risk through implementation of sound policies , procedures and staff training on proper implementation of operational manuals by the operational units . additionally the bank has
